column4: Hi, I'm looking to purchase a laptop (incidentally, my first one) and am looking for something that will work well with ubuntu / kubuntu. I would appreciate any advice on how best to choose one.
I'd obviously not like to pay for a copy of Windows Vista while doing so either.
I don't want to pay for it either
and I want a laptop that will run well under kubuntu
but the windows vista point is also important to me as I don't want to support M$
- also check out Ubuntu's home page - pretty sure they give a list of certified hardware that ubuntu runs on inc the Toshiba Satellite U300 - which imo is a v nice maching
Thanks. No HD-DVD drive I hope :)
that is very helpful - thanks. Most of the sites I've been checking out are dated. This looks promising.
any idea what the norm is nowadays in terms of battery life? 4 hours?
- I have no idea - my poor old dell c400 now has a battery life of about 15mins -
do you know if Toshiba allow you to ditch windows?
- not sure - be suprised if it was easy to do :)
- why not go for the dell? I've always found dell rather good
I actually want to - but they essentially told me that it's not possible except on their precision models.
